channel.title: Get get Linux or Not to get Linux?
channel.description: I'm sick of microsoft and of all their bs. I want to use a 64-bit processor, but IM NOT GETTING VISTA! How hard is Linux to use/understand/program? Looking for some advice. Thanks XD

item.title: Get get Linux or Not to get Linux?
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“kmb, post:7, topic:66026”][quote author=rjop455 link=topic=96139.msg998236#msg998236 date=1173606718]
I made the switch! I am using ubuntu right now! Just one question. Does scar work with linux?
[/quote]
Last time I checked with Wine, no.[/quote]
It does now.

rjop455:

I made the switch! I am using ubuntu right now! Just one question. Does scar work with linux?

type sudo apt-get install wine

then, download SCAR, navigate to the directory where you downloaded it, and do wine SCARSetup.exe (or whatever the file name is )

Read full topic

item.title: Get get Linux or Not to get Linux?
item.dc:creator: @afi afi
item.description:
@afi wrote:

rjop455:

I looked at them, and I’ve tried http://ubuntu.org/. I downloaded it and everything, but I can’t get it to boot from cd. I have a spare hard drive and I want that just to be a full linux OS no windows. Where should I go/do?

Burn the ISO to a Disc then boot into it from the disc on hard drive and run Install Process and hook up your EXT HD to the computer and install onto that.

Read full topic

item.title: Get get Linux or Not to get Linux?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

In some ways it is more user friendly than windows, but since it is slightly different expect being a little confused for 2 or 3 days. I prefer kubuntu, or xubuntu to ubuntu, but they are all basically the same, I would suggest any one of them.

Read full topic
